messages.message:
I cannot upload a folder, getting this `SDLC` error (env=minikube):

```[2020-05-19 02:24:39,107] {/instabase/file-tservice/instabase/storage/fileservice/localclient.py:38} INFO - File does not exist /home/ibuser/data/93c4d01f-542f-4dea-bddc-6a6f54b84e0b/files/.ibsdlc
[2020-05-19 02:24:39,107] {/instabase/file-tservice/instabase/storage/fileservice/util/fs_common.py:44} ERROR - stat: Path files/.ibsdlc does not exist.```
Is there a feature flag to disable SDLC? (i cant find “*sdlc” any in a config json)
cc: @Aaron Vontell
That error is fine, it is caught and handled
oh! it does not let me upload any file/folder and this is all i see in fileservice logs. Rebuilding the api server and webapp to get latest code.
I don’t think this is an sdlc issue, I’ve seen those logs before and they shouldn’t interfere with file operations
are there other error msgs you’re seeing?
okay, that helps. i can scope this reason out.
ah! rebuilding the whole stack worked. my webapp image was not updated to latest build, i.e. 5 days webapp code.
